Class Inventory

  • java.lang.Object
    • Inventory

  • public class Inventory
extends java.lang.Object
    The purpose of this class is to use the inventory array of FoodItems to populate the inventory, buy, sell, and check item codes if it exists to either allow or disallow the user to enter that code
    Since:
    1.8

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Inventory()
      The constructor has no parameters and returns nothing.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean addItem(java.util.Scanner scan)
      This method will prompt you to enter the values for the FoodItem that the user chooses.
      java.lang.String toString()
      This method has no parameters and returns a String is the toString that was will print out every item in the inventory line by line.
      boolean updateQuantity(java.util.Scanner scan, boolean buyOrSell)
      This method prompts the user to enter the item code of the item the user would like to purchase or sell, depending on the condition of the item code matching one in inventory.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • Inventory

        public Inventory()
        The constructor has no parameters and returns nothing. It initializes the size of inventory to 20 FoodItems; As well as numItems at 0 as there is nothing in inventory yet.

    • Method Detail

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        This method has no parameters and returns a String is the toString that was will print out every item in the inventory line by line.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        String

      • addItem

        public boolean addItem(java.util.Scanner scan)
        This method will prompt you to enter the values for the FoodItem that the user chooses. It makes use of the toUpperCase() to simplify case options to only be capital letters it then will prompt the user for the itemCode they wish to act on, and checks whether it exists and fails or it does not exist and prompts the user for the rest of the values.
        Parameters:
        scan - Scanner to prompt user for input.
        Returns:
        true if adding was successful,false if the code exists.

      • updateQuantity

        public boolean updateQuantity(java.util.Scanner scan,
                              boolean buyOrSell)
        This method prompts the user to enter the item code of the item the user would like to purchase or sell, depending on the condition of the item code matching one in inventory. then it tries to validate the amount entered before finally updating the item
        Parameters:
        scan - Scanner to take user input
        buyOrSell - boolean that makes true=buy and false=sell
        Returns:
        return used to determine if buying or selling was successful
